intro: Dorycnium parviflorum, commonly known as the lesser burclover, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its seed pods are hairy and contain several small, kidney-shaped seeds. Dorycnium parviflorum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
